title: ERA5 rainfall – quick look
text:
Minimal example using xarray + cfgrib (local GRIB files).
Replace PATH_TO_GRIB with your local file; this page won’t fetch data.


| echo: true
import xarray as xr import matplotlib.pyplot as plt


Example: daily total precipitation (tp) GRIB you downloaded locally
path = “PATH_TO_GRIB/era5_tp_daily_2020-01-01.grib” # ds = xr.open_dataset(path, engine=“cfgrib”)


Placeholder plot (uncomment lines above and adapt when you have data)
import numpy as np lat = np.linspace(-60,60,121) lon = np.linspace(-180,180,361) data = np.random.gamma(2, 1, (121, 361))
plt.figure() plt.imshow(data, extent=[lon.min(), lon.max(), lat.min(), lat.max()], origin=“lower”) plt.title(“ERA5 tp – mock plot (replace with ds.tp[0])”) plt.xlabel(“lon”); plt.ylabel(“lat”) plt.show()

title: About
text:
I’m Mmit Reklaw. I work at the intersection of climate risk, (re)insurance, and data-driven modelling.
This site is a public lab notebook for the Re:current project: small, composable models; clean notes; reproducible code.
Focus areas: hazard analytics, parametric triggers, time-series, energy–water systems, serious games.
Elsewhere: GitHub
